QAPair.Question: What is (are) Crush injury ?
QAPair.Answer: A crush injury occurs when excessive force or pressure is put on a body part. This type of injury most often happens when part of the body is squeezed between two heavy objects. Damage related to crush injuries include: Bleeding , Bruising , Compartment syndrome (increased pressure, usually in an arm or leg, that causes serious muscle, nerve, blood vessel, and tissue damage), Broken bone (fracture), Open wound (laceration), Nerve injury , Infection (caused by bacteria that enter the body through a wound) ,
